results.title: Begone dull care
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren, Evelyn Lambart and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A lively interpretation of jazz music played by the Oscar Peterson Trio. The music is visually represented in a series of abstract lines and shapes, hand painted directly on to the film, culminating in a fast and furious explosion as the tempo quickens. One of the high points of jazz in cinema (and of McLaren’s career).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman McLaren, Evelyn Lambart and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Words and silk
results.creator_credit: Philip Tyndall, John Cruthers and Kangaroo Films
results.brief_description: A two part program about the life and works of Australian fiction writer, Gerald Murnane. Pt. 1. The imaginary and real world of Gerald Murnane (41 min.) The first part explores his imaginary world and presents images both of Murnane’s childhood in Victoria during the 1940’s and of his interests, particularly his obsession with horseracing. Pt. 2. The real and imaginary world of Gerald Murnane (45 min.) In the second part Murnane discusses his writing style and reads extracts from Tamarisk Row to show how he weaves his interests and obsessions into his work.

results.title: Conservation tillage protecting our greatest asset
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Protecting Our Greatest Asset”.
It should be noted that this video is made by a chemical company that manufactures herbicides. Intensive cropping and continual cultivation stresses the Australian soil dramatically. This video looks at alternative methods to soil tillage by machinery, namely herbicides. Crops which require no tillage as conservation are also discussed.

results.title: In the shadow of Hollywood [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Sylvie Groulx, Eric Michel and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: With its barrage of special effects, its new heroes and warrior myths, the American dream is not what it used to be. Aided by new trade strategies, Hollywood is tightening its stranglehold on the world’s screens, leaving no room for indigenous cultures. Disturbed by this one-sided war of images, the director consults filmmakers and other experts on both sides of the Atlantic. Agnieszka Holland, Arthur Penn, Alain Tanner, Bertrand Tavernier, Milos Forman and Denys Arcand ponder the fate of cinema in the era of globalization. Can auteur cinema with its personal vision, its expression of the collective identity, withstand the onslaught of American movies and their single-minded focus on entertainment? Includes interviews with Denys Arcand, Anne-Marie Bidaud, Luciana Castellina, Milos Forman, Claude Fournier, Agnieszka Holland, Marin Karmitz, Todd McCarthy, Jonathan Nossiter, Arthur Penn, Leslie Quinton, Roland Smith, Jean-Charles Tacchella, Alain Tanner, Bertrand Tavernier, Daniel Toscan du Plantier, Margarethe Von Trotta, Andrzej Wajda and Irwin Winkler. In English and French with English subtitles.

results.title: Panorama: the state wide screen [excerpts No. 1]
results.brief_description: Excerpts from the Panorama documentary on the State Film Centre of Victoria. Candid footage of the goings on at the S.F.C.V. in Carlton in the early sixties. Customer service, despatch operations, film retrieving, checking and cleaning, and free film screenings in urban and rural areas.

results.title: Bare
results.creator_credit: Amanda Roberts, Wild Iris Productions, Liz Baulch and Deborah Strutt
results.brief_description: There are misunderstandings aplenty in this award-winning Australian short when 2 gay boys accidentally catch their lesbian neighbours in an early morning clinch. High density living in all its revealing glory.

results.title: On guard
results.creator_credit: Susan Lambert, Digby Duncan and Red Heart Pictures
results.brief_description: A fast moving adventure about four women who conspire to sabotage the research program of Utero, a multinational firm engaged in reproductive engineering. They plan a midnight raid on Utero’s heavily guarded plant and as the time for the raid approaches, tensions between the four saboteurs increase.

results.title: The Bowater story
results.creator_credit: Arthur Graham, World Wide Pictures and Bowater
results.brief_description: A story of industrial growth and enterprise - in 1926 the British company Bowater began making paper as well as selling it, and now owns mills and forests in many parts of the world including Norway, Sweden, USA, France, New Zealand and Australia.
